job_details.Functieomschrijving:
At HackerOne, we're on a mission to empower the world to build a safer internet. We're a growing engineering team with an outsized impact, and we're looking for a Software Engineer IC3 to help us innovate and propel our platform forward.

   As a Software Engineer IC3, you will work with the seniors of the team, and with Product Managers and Designers and build delightful features and products for our community, as well as the thousands of companies who trust HackerOne with their cybersecurity posture.

   You are a collaborative and effective software engineer and team member. You will interact with CSM's, who are the voice of our customers. You will guide and coach the more junior IC's.

   You'll combine your technological expertise, domain knowledge, and an unquestionable dedication to business objectives as you intersect with the engineering organization. You identify and make systematic improvements to technical weaknesses you'll find in your squad's codebases, and in shared codebases across the company.

   Your Journey at HackerOne
     * Your day will start with a warm welcome online and get your tools to start!
     * Your first 30 days will be focusing on getting to know our HackerOnies. You will join your new squad and being onboarded - get to learn the technology stack (Ruby on Rails + GraphQL + ReactJS + many more)
     * Within 60 days, you will have committed a bunch of code to our repositories and will start developing a knack for being a fast and effective software engineer on our codebase
     * Within 90 days, you will start getting ready to lead your first project as Software Engineer - you will have branched out and talked to Sales, Marketing and various other functions, and developed a good sense of cross-functional collaboration and communication
     * Beyond 90 days, you will be a fully-fledged software engineer
     * By that time you will be able to understand the business value of our products and features, and the needs of our customers
     * And you are able to translate feature requests into simple, but robust engineering (or non-engineering) solutions, You can:
     * Make an impact on a squad and project level.
     * Coordinate efforts around new initiatives with the senior engineers

   HackerOne Values

   HackerOne commits to maintaining the strong, inclusive culture we've built for our employees and our community of hackers. As a team, we
     * Lead with integrity. Integrity is doing the right thing when no one is watching
     * Default to disclosure. Ask "Why should this be private?" instead of "Why should this be public?"
     * Execute with excellence. Hold yourself and others to the highest standards of performance
     * Win as a team. Compete to achieve excellence. Enable each other to do our best
     * Respect all people. We prioritize diversity, equity, inclusion, and dignity for all

   Compensation Bands:
   Tier Guide

   UK and Ireland: 72k-85k pounds
job_details.full_text:
Software Engineer III

At HackerOne, we're on a mission to empower the world to build a safer internet. We're a growing engineering team with an outsized impact, and we're looking for a Software Engineer IC3 to help us innovate and propel our platform forward.

   As a Software Engineer IC3, you will work with the seniors of the team, and with Product Managers and Designers and build delightful features and products for our community, as well as the thousands of companies who trust HackerOne with their cybersecurity posture.

   You are a collaborative and effective software engineer and team member. You will interact with CSM's, who are the voice of our customers. You will guide and coach the more junior IC's.

   You'll combine your technological expertise, domain knowledge, and an unquestionable dedication to business objectives as you intersect with the engineering organization. You identify and make systematic improvements to technical weaknesses you'll find in your squad's codebases, and in shared codebases across the company.

   Your Journey at HackerOne
     * Your day will start with a warm welcome online and get your tools to start!
     * Your first 30 days will be focusing on getting to know our HackerOnies. You will join your new squad and being onboarded - get to learn the technology stack (Ruby on Rails + GraphQL + ReactJS + many more)
     * Within 60 days, you will have committed a bunch of code to our repositories and will start developing a knack for being a fast and effective software engineer on our codebase
     * Within 90 days, you will start getting ready to lead your first project as Software Engineer - you will have branched out and talked to Sales, Marketing and various other functions, and developed a good sense of cross-functional collaboration and communication
     * Beyond 90 days, you will be a fully-fledged software engineer
     * By that time you will be able to understand the business value of our products and features, and the needs of our customers
     * And you are able to translate feature requests into simple, but robust engineering (or non-engineering) solutions, You can:
     * Make an impact on a squad and project level.
     * Coordinate efforts around new initiatives with the senior engineers

   HackerOne Values

   HackerOne commits to maintaining the strong, inclusive culture we've built for our employees and our community of hackers. As a team, we
     * Lead with integrity. Integrity is doing the right thing when no one is watching
     * Default to disclosure. Ask "Why should this be private?" instead of "Why should this be public?"
     * Execute with excellence. Hold yourself and others to the highest standards of performance
     * Win as a team. Compete to achieve excellence. Enable each other to do our best
     * Respect all people. We prioritize diversity, equity, inclusion, and dignity for all

   Compensation Bands:
   Tier Guide

   UK and Ireland: 72k-85k pounds

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses heavily on traditional software engineering tasks, collaboration, and business objectives, with no mention of AI, machine learning, generative models, or related technologies. The role is described as a 'Software Engineer' and emphasizes building features and products, interacting with various departments, and leading projects within a technology stack that includes Ruby on Rails, GraphQL, and ReactJS. There is no evidence to suggest it falls under the ML Engineer or GenAI Engineer profiles.

job_tasks.justification: The description states 'You'll combine your technological expertise, domain knowledge, and an unquestionable dedication to business objectives' and 'By that time you will be able to understand the business value of our products and features, and the needs of our customers'. This directly relates to understanding business context and aligning technical solutions with strategic goals.
The phrase 'translate feature requests into simple, but robust engineering (or non-engineering) solutions' indicates the ability to translate business needs into technical requirements.
job_tasks.phrase: translate feature requests into simple, but robust engineering (or non-engineering) solutions

job_tasks.justification: The core of the role involves working with Product Managers and Designers to 'build delightful features and products for our community, as well as the thousands of companies'. This is a direct description of software development for user-facing products.

The mention of learning the 'technology stack (Ruby on Rails + GraphQL + ReactJS + many more)' and committing 'a bunch of code to our repositories' points to traditional software development activities.
job_tasks.phrase: learn the technology stack (Ruby on Rails + GraphQL + ReactJS + many more)

job_tasks.justification: The statement 'start developing a knack for being a fast and effective software engineer on our codebase' directly refers to the skills and activities of a software engineer.
job_tasks.phrase: fast and effective software engineer on our codebase

job_tasks.justification: The role involves identifying and making 'systematic improvements to technical weaknesses you'll find in your squad's codebases, and in shared codebases across the company', which is a software engineering task focused on code quality and maintainability.

While not explicitly MLOps, the phrase 'Coordinate efforts around new initiatives with the senior engineers' and 'lead your first project' implies managing and overseeing technical efforts, which has some overlap with operational coordination.

The description states 'You are a collaborative and effective software engineer and team member' and 'You will interact with CSM's, who are the voice of our customers'. This highlights the importance of collaboration and interaction with different roles.
job_tasks.phrase: collaborative and effective software engineer and team member

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'developed a good sense of cross-functional collaboration and communication' directly points to the need for strong communication and collaboration skills across different departments.

The onboarding process described ('Your first 30 days will be focusing on getting to know our HackerOnies. You will join your new squad and being onboarded - get to learn the technology stack') and the progression milestones ('Within 60 days', 'Within 90 days') imply a need for learning and adapting to the company's environment and technologies.
job_tasks.phrase: get to learn the technology stack

job_tasks.justification: The ability to 'translate feature requests into simple, but robust engineering (or non-engineering) solutions' demonstrates problem-solving skills with a focus on creating effective and practical solutions.
job_tasks.phrase: simple, but robust engineering (or non-engineering) solutions

job_tasks.justification: Identifying and making 'systematic improvements to technical weaknesses' is a form of problem-solving focused on improving existing systems.
The statement 'You'll combine your technological expertise, domain knowledge, and an unquestionable dedication to business objectives' suggests a proactive and dedicated approach to work.
The description mentions 'Make an impact on a squad and project level' and 'lead your first project as Software Engineer', which implies taking initiative and ownership.
job_tasks.phrase: Make an impact on a squad and project level

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Coordinate efforts around new initiatives with the senior engineers' suggests taking initiative and leading efforts.

soft_skills.phrase: collaborative and effective software engineer and team member
guide and coach the more junior IC's
get to learn the technology stack
simple, but robust engineering (or non-engineering) solutions
Make an impact on a squad and project level
